Conclusion Draft
To watch politicians bicker, one can see that the debate currently belongs to a culture of war. Debaters confront their rival, strike, and retaliate as they shoot down each other’s claims with the intent to cripple or destroy their opponent’s assertions. However, a carefully choreographed Two-Step, Twist, or Tango can just as easily and more gracefully persuade an audience through a show of facts and examples. Changing the argument‘s traditional culture of war to one of dance will change the tone of the discourse from aggression to civility.
